borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed development for reasons of scale, mass, bulk, siting and design would result in unacceptable levels of overshadowing and the harmful loss of outlook number 10 <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="Buller" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lbc5mvm42k4oczc1u" style="">Buller</span> Road. The proposal presents overbearing and unneighbourly development and would significantly impinge upon these households' quality of life and standard of living. Thus, this proposal is considered unacceptable and contrary to: National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="DLUHC" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lbc5ndrkj4mnazbxa" style="">DLUHC</span>, 2021), Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021), Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010), Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011), The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012), Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span><br>

<div>The bulk, mass, size, siting and design of the proposed development are considered harmful to the appearance of the modest-sized house, built form of the symmetrical terrace row and character of the area. <span style="font-size: 14px;">T</span>he proposal presents an uncharacteristic development especially&nbsp;when combined with existing development on site, resulting in a disproportionately sized house compared to the rest street, as such it is considered unacceptable and contrary to<span style="font-size: 14px;">: National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp; (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021), Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021), Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010), Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011), The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012), Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021).</span></div>
description: Construction of a first floor rear extension
